definition: field of blood/battlefield/hateful place/Aceldama (field bought by Judas Iscariot with his 30 pieces of silver in Matthew 27:7)

sentences.english: Wherefore that field was called, The field of blood, unto this day.
sentences.chinese: 所以那塊田，直到今日還叫作血田。

sentences.english: Therefore that field has been called the Field of Blood to this day.
sentences.chinese: 所以那塊田直到今日還叫做血田。

sentences.english: That is why it has been called the Field of Blood to this day.
sentences.chinese: 所以那塊田，直到今日還叫作血田。

definition: variant of 紀念|纪念[ji4 nian4]
Gongliao or Kungliao township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
port/flat land next to a river or ocean
archaic variant of 蘇|苏[su1]/to revive
to meet with disaster/killed/in the clutches of the enemy/to fall foul of/in danger
foreign devil/wartime term of abuse for Japanese
Gideon (name, from Judges 6:11-ffoll.)/also written 吉迪恩
Abba (Aramaic word father)/by ext. God the Father in Christian gospel
